body:
In the old config system (eslintrc), you could define configs inside of plugins like this:

https://eslint.org/docs/latest/developer-guide/working-with-plugins

in the new config system (flat config), there is no longer an “extends” option. Instead, you can just reference the configs property directly and insert the object into the array. So include a plugin in your config file as described here:

 https://eslint.org/docs/latest/user-guide/configuring/configuration-files-new#using-plugins-in-your-configuration
 
And then you can use `jsdoc.configs.recommended` as one member of the array that is exported from eslint.config.JS. 

(On the phone right now, so can’t type out a full example. Let me know if that’s not clear enough.)
if you could provide a full example, that'd be helpful. i'm still not fully grasping the difference here.
